properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Unseasonably warm weather expected for the start of the Canada Day weekend. Saturday and Sunday are shaping up to be sunny with afternoon cloudy periods and isolated afternoon showers on Sunday. Temperatures will be about 5 degrees above seasonal normals for the period. This comes close to the Heat Warning criteria of at least 28 C for two or more consecutive days with an overnight low above 13 C. However, the amount of cloud cover, forest fire smoke and overnight cooling are still uncertain at this time and will play a major role in determining the temperatures. A Heat Warning may be issued later if conditions warrant. - Check the local news for health and safety updates. - Contact your local government to find out what services (such as air-conditioned buildings and public splash parks) are available in your area. - Environment and Climate Change Canada and Regional Medical Health officers expect an increase in health and safety risks from heat and are advising the public to take precautions. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-29T13:00:46-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-29T05:01:46-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1073581990.2019
Area: Dawson, Mayo, Beaver Creek, Pelly - Carmacks
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wildfire smoke is creating locally reduced visibilities and producing poor air quality. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. For more information please visit Alberta Health Services at www.albertahealthservices.ca/news/air.aspx. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-06-29T20:01:41-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, Alberta Environment and Parks, Alberta Health, Alberta Health Services, 2019-06-29T04:02:41-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3717871258.2019
Area: Mackenzie Co. near Bistcho Lake, Mackenzie Co. near Rainbow Lake Zama Lake and Chateh, Mackenzie Co. near Zama City, Mackenzie Co. near Indian Cabins and Steen River, Mackenzie Co. near Meander River and Lutose, Mackenzie Co. near High Level and Bushe River Res., Co. of Northern Lights near Paddle Prairie Smt, Mackenzie Co. near the Caribou Mountains, Mackenzie Co. near Fort Vermilion, Mackenzie Co. near John D'or Prairie and Fox Lake, Mackenzie Co. near La Crête and Buffalo Head Prairie, Mackenzie Co. near the Tallcree and Wadlin Lake Reserves

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots, frequent lightning and hail this afternoon and evening. ### Large hail can damage vessels and cause injury. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 12:41 a.m. CST, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This severe thunderstorm is located near Cupar. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-06-29T09:40:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-29T06:42:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1886096044.2019
Area: R.M. of Cupar including Southey Cupar and Markinch
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and torrential rain. Severe thunderstorms are possible across southeastern Saskatchewan tonight as a trough of low pressure tracks eastward through the night. ### Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-29T11:19:06-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 12:15 a.m. CST, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a dangerous thunderstorm capable of producing damaging wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This line is located near Ceylon and is heading to the northeast at 70 km/h. This line is capable of producing damaging wind gusts in excess of 110 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-06-29T08:49:59-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-29T06:16:59-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2997951528.2019

properties.Summary:

Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, continues. A slow moving low pressure system continues to affect west central Alberta. The rain is expected to continue in the Grand Cache region until Saturday. Storm totals by Saturday afternoon are expected to to be 50 to 75 mm. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-29T22:13:32-00:00

This line is located from near Cedoux to Torquay and is heading to the east-northeast at 70 km/h. This line is capable of producing damaging wind gusts in excess of 110 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-06-29T09:59:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-29T07:52:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2535998268.2019
